MessageStrip.text: By default, Toolbar items are shrinkable if they have percent-based width (e.g. Input, Slider) or implement the IShrinkable interface (e.g. Text, Label).

Label.text: I am a text control, so I will shrink whenever the toolbar overflows.

SearchField.placeholder: My width is 100%, so I should shrink.

MessageStrip.text: You can configure the item's shrinking-related properties by providing ToolbarLayoutData.

Button.text: I am a shrinkable button, so I will shrink whenever the toolbar overflows.

SearchField.placeholder: I have a fixed width (200px), so I cannot shrink.

MessageStrip.text: You can determine to what extent an item shrinks by setting minWidth/maxWidth via ToolbarLayoutData. By default, minWidth is 48px in the Blue Crystal theme.

Label.text: I should not shrink by more than 200px, because I am an important text.

Button.text: I cannot be wider than 400px, but I can shrink up to the theme's default minimum width.
